sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A metal sphere has a radius of 7 cm. Determine the volume of the sphere, in cubic centimeters (cm³).
message_2:
To find the volume of a sphere, we use the formula:

V = (4/3)πr³

where V is the volume, r is the radius, and π (pi) is a constant approximately equal to 3.14159.

Given that the radius of the sphere is 7 cm, we can plug this value into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(7 cm)³

V = (4/3)π(343 cm³)

V ≈ (4/3)(3.14159)(343 cm³)

V ≈ 1436.76 cm³

The volume of the sphere is approximately 1436.76 cubic centimeters (cm³).
